tablr

Class TableDesignHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • tablr.TableDesignHandler

  • public class TableDesignHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsibility:
    provide a controller for the table design mode and its use cases.
    Invariant:
    the handler always has a TableManager.
        getTableManager() != null

    • Constructor Detail

      • TableDesignHandler

        @Raw
TableDesignHandler(TableManager mng)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a tableDesignHandler with the given tableManager.
        Parameters:
        mng - the tableManager this handler is created for.
        Postcondition:
        the tableManager for this is set to mng.
            if(canHaveAsTableManager(mng){getTableManager() == mng}
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if mng is invalid. | !canHaveAsTableManager(mng)

      • canHaveAsColumnName

        public boolean canHaveAsColumnName(java.lang.String columnName,
                                   java.lang.String newName)
                            throws IllegalColumnException,
                                   IllegalTableException
        Check whether the column with given column name can have the given name.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The name of the column of which the given name should be checked.
        newName - The name to be checked
        Returns:
        True if and only if the column can accept the given name and if the name is not already used in this table, if it is already used and the name is the same as the given columnName, then the name is also acceptable.
            if (getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getColumn(columnName).canHaveAsName(newName))
                then result == ( getTableManager().getCurrentTable().isAlreadyUsedColumnName(newName) && !columnName.equals(newName) )
        Throws:
        IllegalColumnException - There is no column in this table with the given column name. | !getTableManager().getCurrentTable().isAlreadyUsedColumnName(columnName)
        IllegalTableException - If there is no open table. | getOpenTable() == null.

      • setColumnName

        public void setColumnName(java.lang.String columnName,
                          java.lang.String newColumnName)
                   throws IllegalColumnException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          IllegalTableException
        Set the name of the given columnName to the given name.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The columnName of which the name must be changed.
        newColumnName - The new name of the given columnName
        Effect:
        The name of the given columnName is set to the given name.
            getTableManager().getColumn(columnName).setName(newColumnName)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given newColumnName is already used for another columnName in this table. | getTableManager().getCurrentTable().isAlreadyUsedColumnName(newColumnName)
        IllegalColumnException - The given columnName doesn't exist in this table. | !getTableManager().getCurrentTable().isAlreadyUsedColumnName(columnName)
        IllegalTableException - If there is no open table. | getOpenTable() == null.

      • setColumnType

        public void setColumnType(java.lang.String columnName,
                          java.lang.String type)
                   throws IllegalColumnException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          IllegalTableException
        Set the type of the given column to the given type.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The column of which the type must be set.
        type - The new type to be set.
        Effect:
        The given type is set as the type of the given column.
        Throws:
        IllegalColumnException - The given column doesn't exists in this table. | !getTableManager().getCurrentTable().isAlreadyUsedColumnName(column)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given type cannot be a type of the given table. | !getTableManager().getCurrentTable().canHaveAsColumnType(columnName, type)
        IllegalTableException - If there is no open table. | getOpenTable() == null.

      • setColumnAllowBlanks

        public void setColumnAllowBlanks(java.lang.String columnName,
                                 boolean blanksAllowed)
                          throws IllegalColumnException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 IllegalTableException
        Set the blanksAllowed allowed of the column with the given column name to the given blanksAllowed.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The name of the column of which the allow blanksAllowed should be set.
        blanksAllowed - The blanksAllowed to be set.
        Effect:
        The blanksAllowed of the column with the given column name are set to the given blanksAllowed.
            getTableManager().getCurrentTable().getColumn(columnName).setBlanksAllowed(blanksAllowed)
        Throws:
        IllegalColumnException - There is no column in this table with the given column name. | !getTableManager().getCurrentTable().isAlreadyUsedColumnName(columnName)
        IllegalTableException - If there is no open table. | getOpenTable() == null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • addColumn

        public void addColumn()
               throws IllegalTableException
        Add a new column as a column for this table at the end of the columns list
        Effect:
        A new column is added at the end of the table.
            getTableManager().getCurrentTable().addColumnAt(getNbColumns() + 1)
        Throws:
        IllegalTableException - If there is no open table. | getOpenTable() == null.

      • removeColumn

        public void removeColumn(java.lang.String name)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         IllegalTableException
        Remove the column of this table with the given column name
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the column to be removed.
        Effect:
        The column which has the given name, will be removed from the list columns.
            getTableManager().getCurrentTable().removeColumnAt(getColumnIndex(name))
        Throws:
        IllegalColumnException - The given name is not a name of a column in this table.
        IllegalTableException - If there is no open table. | getOpenTable() == null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
